screenshot.alt: Screenshot of a .zdl file in Avery Design & Print 8
screenshot.caption: ZDL file open in Avery Design & Print 8

description: ZDL files are similar to .ZDP and .ZDS files, which are also used by DesignPro for storing label data. However, ZDL files are created by DesignPro 5.0, while ZDP files are created by DesignPro 3.5 - 4.0 and ZDS files are created by DesignPro 5.1 and later.

You can create and open ZDL files with DesignPro. However, DesignPro was discontinued and replaced by Design & Print, which can also be used to open ZDL files. After opening a ZDL file in Design & Print, you can save it as an .AVERY file, which is the main file type associated with Design & Print.

images.caption: ZDL file open in Avery Design & Print 8
